creditline: Gift of the Joseph F. McCrindle Collection
description: clump of tall, thin brown trees at center R; young thin tree at L; other light foliage in background; green grass; sky visible in ULC
marks:
Signature and Inscription

See Signed LRC, in dark green: [ROMA/O Carlandi]
text: Onorato Carlandi was one of the founding members of the Society of Roman Watercolorists, established in 1875. He worked almost exclusively in landscape, depicting stunning views of Rome, his hometown, and even more often, its scenic surroundings. In this remarkably fresh watercolor, Carlandi skillfully reserves specks of the bare white paper to mimic the flickering light that dapples budding branches in springtime.
title: Spring Landscape with Trees
